current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To provide for a delay of the individual mandate under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act until the American Health Benefit Exchanges are functioning properly.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read the first time

action-desc.#text: Read the second time and placed on the calendar
Read the second time and placed on the calendar

short-title.#text: Delay Until Fully Functional Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Delay in the individual mandate and exemption from penalty

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended to read as follows:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 1501(d) of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1501/ss:d

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Inspector General for the Department of Health and Human Services

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1501/ss:d/p:3

text.#text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning 6 months after the date on which the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Delay Until Fully Functional Act of 2013
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Delay Until Fully Functional Act of 2013

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall conduct a study to determine whether the American Health Benefit Exchanges, including the Exchange administered by the Federal Government, and all other point of enrollment options (including telephone and postal options), are fully functional and operating in a manner consistent with the role envisioned for Exchanges under this Act, and submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a report concerning the results of such study.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Comptroller General of the United States

text.#text: Not later than 30 days after the date of enactment of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1501/ss:d/p:2/sp:A

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: determines that the Exchanges are not fully functional and operating  in a manner consistent with the role envisioned for Exchanges under this Act, the
shall conduct one or more subsequent studies every 60 days (and submit reports based on the results of such studies) until the
determines that the Exchanges are fully functional and operating in such manner.

text.#text: If, based  on the results of the study conducted under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: that determines that the American Health Benefit Exchanges are fully functional  and operating in a manner consistent with the role envisioned for Exchanges under this Act, the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1501/ss:d/p:2

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Inspector General for the Department of Health and Human Services

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: a certification (in writing) of the results of such report.

text.#text: Upon the submission of a report under

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall adjust the dates in such section accordingly based on the application of this subsection.
is amended by adding at the end the following:

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

text.#text: The provisions of this section shall not apply to an individual who is unable to enroll in a qualified health plan because of the technical or customer service issues of an American Health Benefit Exchange, as determined by the

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S1592 PCS: Delay Until Fully Functional Act of 2013
